content.question:
​

The graph of function f shows a curve and two horizontal dashed lines. The x axis ranges from negative 2 to 3 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 2 to 2 in increments of 1. The curve is asymptotic to the two horizontal dashed lines.

Main description of f
Moving from left to right:

The first horizontal dashed line is labeled y equals pi over 2.

The second horizontal dashed line is labeled y equals negative pi over 2. 

The curve for f begins above the horizontal dashed line labeled y equals negative pi over 2 in quadrant 3.

The curve for f trends gradually up and to the right, passes through approximately (negative 1.5 comma negative 1), passes through the origin, and passes through approximately (1.5 comma 1).

The curve for f continues up, ending below the horizontal dashed line labeled y equals pi over 2 in quadrant 1.

The graph of function g shows a curve and two horizontal dashed lines. The x axis ranges from negative 5 to 5 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 1 to 3 in increments of 1. The curve is asymptotic to the two horizontal dashed lines.

Main description of g
Moving from left to right:

The first horizontal dashed line is labeled y equals 1 plus pi over 2.

The second horizontal dashed line is labeled y equals 1 minus pi over 2.

The curve for g begins above the horizontal dashed line labeled y equals 1 minus pi over 2 in quadrant 3.

The curve for g trends gradually up and to the right, passes through approximately (negative 3 comma 0), passes through (0 comma 1), and passes through approximately (3 comma 2).

The curve for g continues up, ending below the horizontal dashed line labeled y equals 1 plus pi over 2 in quadrant 1.

​The figure gives the graphs of the functions <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> in the <math alttext="x y"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>-plane. The function <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is given by <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals tan to the power of negative 1 end exponent x"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>tan</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mi>x</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. Which of the following defines <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="tan to the power of negative 1 end exponent x plus 1"><semantics><mrow><msup><mi>tan</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="tan to the power of negative 1 end exponent x plus pi over 2"><semantics><mrow><msup><mi>tan</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="tan to the power of negative 1 end exponent open parentheses x over 2 close parentheses plus 1"><semantics><mrow><msup><mi>tan</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mfrac><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="tan to the power of negative 1 end exponent open parentheses x over 2 close parentheses plus pi over 2"><semantics><mrow><msup><mi>tan</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mfrac><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="tan to the power of negative 1 end exponent open parentheses x over 2 close parentheses plus 1"><semantics><mrow><msup><mi>tan</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mfrac><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
